comments:
I am brand new to Eclipse.

I downloaded eclipse-SDK-3.1.1-solaris-motif.zip to a Solaris 8 machine, unzipped it, and started eclipse. After specifying a (new) workspace directory, the default Welcome view comes up. I click on the Overview Icon, and the Overview page comes up. 4 links are presented (Workbench basics, Java development, etc.). Clicking on any of these links has no effect.

The workspace/.metadata/.log file contains the following error:

!SESSION 2006-01-23 09:37:46.381 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=solaris, ARCH=sparc, WS=motif, NL=en
Command-line arguments:  -os solaris -ws motif -arch sparc

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 1 2006-01-23 09:37:53.147
!MESSAGE Could not load library: libcore_3_1_0.so.  This library provides platform-specific optimizations for certain file system operations.  This library is not present on all platforms, so this may not be an error.  The resources plug-in will safely fall back to using java.io.File functionality.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.intro 4 0 2006-01-23 09:37:59.671

Here are all the files named swt.properties in the eclipse install directory:

% find . -name swt.properties -ls
28746549    4 -rw-rw-r--   1 scp      research      170 Sep 29 07:11 ./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/intro/css/tutorials/swt.properties
28746552    4 -rw-rw-r--   1 scp      research      201 Sep 29 07:11 ./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/intro/css/samples/swt.properties
28746554    4 -rw-rw-r--   1 scp      research      472 Sep 29 07:11 ./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/intro/css/overview/swt.properties
28746562    4 -rw-rw-r--   1 scp      research      712 Sep 29 07:11 ./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/intro/css/whatsnew/swt.properties
19615765    4 -rw-rw----   1 scp      research     1036 Jan 23 10:31 ./eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/79/1/.cp/intro/css/swt.properties
4655055    4 -rw-rw----   1 scp      research     1489 Jan 23 10:31 ./eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/83/1/.cp/intro/css/swt.properties

using Software Update to update everything in site does not rectify the problem.

I have spent an hour searching for a relevant bug or newsgroup posting, but found nothing I could identify as related.

Well, it turns out that this is due to the use of an incompatible JRE:

% /usr/bin/java -version
java version "1.5.0_04"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_04-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_04-b05, mixed mode, sharing)

I reinstalled the 1.4.2 JRE and it works fine.
